options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: To reduce the complexity of sensory information.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: It is a direct result of sensory signals from the outside world.

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: They are all determined by sensory signals from the outside world.

options.label: D
options.text: They are all products of artificial intelligence.

options.label: B
options.text: It has the potential to become sentient.

options.label: C
options.text: It has the potential to simulate human consciousness.

options.label: D
options.text: It has limitations and cannot become sentient.

options.label: A
options.text: To figure out what's there in the body.

options.label: B
options.text: To control and regulate the internal state of the body.

options.label: C
options.text: To create our experiences of the world around us and ourselves within it.

options.label: D
options.text: To reduce the complexity of sensory information.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's conclusion about the uniqueness of individual consciousness?

options.text: It is a unique phenomenon that cannot be explained by science.

options.label: B
options.text: It is a controlled hallucination generated by the brain.

options.label: C
options.text: It is a direct result of sensory signals from the outside world.

options.text: It is a product of artificial intelligence.

options.label: D
